title: The Unique Shape Of Apple’s Icons Shows Its Commitment To Beautiful Design
text: The Unique Shape Of Apple’s Icons Shows Its Commitment To Beautiful Design By Dorothy Tan , 02 Feb 2017 Subscribe to newsletter Like us on Facebook Even if you are a long-time iOS user, you probably would not have given the shape of the Apple icons much thought—however, the people who have created it did. The shape of these much-used icons has been changed from being rounded squares to something more sophisticated since iOS 7—the reason for this is to create design consistency between the company’s hardware and software. In a post for website Hacker Noon , designer Mark Stanton wrote about how Apple crafts the surfaces on their products according to the principle of curvature continuity, where tangency and sharp shifts in highlights are avoided. Advertisement The amazing dedication to well-designed details is what allows the company to produce beautiful products that consumers want to own and use—this commitment to quality extended to Apple’s digital icon design as well. Read Stanton’s entire article here to find out more about why Apple’s icons look the way they do, and what it says about the tech company’s inspiring design culture.
